subject: Data
title: The Humble Line Chart: Tracking Change Over Time
description: A quick win: understand The Humble Line Chart: Tracking Change Over Time.

hook.text: Stock traders, weather forecasters, and doctors all rely on the same chart type: a simple line.

buildup.text: Line charts connect data points in sequence, showing how a value changes over time.

discovery.text: The human eye naturally follows lines â€” we see trends, spikes, and drops instantly.

twist.text: Line charts can mislead: change the Y-axis scale and a flat trend looks like a dramatic spike.

climax.text: Despite being 240 years old, the line chart remains the most used visualization type worldwide.

punchline.text: The simplest chart is still the most powerful.

quiz.question: What makes line charts especially effective?
options: They show how values change over time intuitively
